#Text=Earth Day 2008 marked in various ways
#Text=Thursday , April 24 , 2008
#Text=April 22 was Earth Day .
#Text=It is a tradition started by United States Senator Gaylord Nelson with the first Earth Day in April 1970 .
#Text=Earth Day Canada was started in 1990 .
#Text=In Central Park , New York , the " Green Apple festival " marked the event .
#Text=In Buenos Aires an " an entertainment event with an awareness component . "

column1: #Text=Golden Gate Park , San Francisco , also held an event to mark the day .
#Text=This event is similar to an event last year that marked last year 's earth day .
#Text=There were also events to mark the day in Caracas , Venezuela .
#Text=The Earth Day website said " youth groups from Universities will make a vow as Citizens of the World and will launch Beja Contest 2008 , " in its description of these events .
#Text=There were also events in Chicago .
#Text=According to the Earth Day website , Lincoln Park Zoo hosted some of these events .
#Text=Events in Tokyo , Japan also marked the day .
#Text=The Earth Day website says that the " booth and Event Area within Yoyogi Park " hosted the event .
#Text=Other places across the world also marked the day .

#Text=The Earth day website says that " Earth Day 2008 is expected to be the biggest yet , From Tokyo to Togo , to our flagship event on the National Mall in Washington , DC and 7 other U.S. cities , we will be galvanizing millions of people around the world behind a Call for Climate , our global warming action theme . "
#Text=Jim Connaughton , the chairman of Council on Environmental Quality for the US government , described Earth Day and explained how it was founded .
#Text=Below is his description :
#Text=On April 22 , 1970 , 20 million people across America celebrated the first Earth Day .
#Text=It was a time when cities were buried under their own smog and polluted rivers caught fire .
#Text=Now Earth Day is celebrated annually around the globe .

#Text=Through the combined efforts of the U.S. government , grassroots organizations , and citizens like you , what started as a day of national environmental recognition has evolved into a world-wide campaign to protect our global environment — a campaign that truly is now a part of our daily lives , not just a one day event every year .
#Text=Earth Day has become a great tradition in our country .
#Text=It ’s a day that reminds us that we must be good stewards of our natural resources .
#Text=To the President , Earth Day is a reminder that we ca n’t take our land and resources for granted .
#Text=The President and Mrs. Bush believe we have responsibilities to conserve what we have , and work to make it better .
#Text=Connaughton also described what George W. Bush is doing to mark the event :
#Text=The President is in New Orleans , Louisiana hosting Mexican President Calderon and Canadian Prime Minister Harper for the North American Leaders Summit .
#Text=They took time out their schedule today to join New Orleans Mayor Nagin for a tree planting ceremony to commemorate Earth Day .
#Text=The President planted a Shumard oak tree as a reminder of our global duty to protect the environment .
#Text=New Orleans lost about 250,000 trees to Hurricanes Katrina and Rita – about 50,000 of those trees were in public spaces like Lafayette Square .
#Text=Replanting trees is vital not only to recovery of the city ’s character , but also its environment .
